chargeHist.descr: Operating a Motor Vehicle w/o Owner's Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jared A. Erickson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 

2 days of jail credit if revoked from Probation

miscConds.notes:
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.

records.addlTxt:
11:19 AM Defendant Jared A. Erickson in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Jared A. Erickson.  Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. The parties have an agreement. Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count 1: Possession of Narcotic Drugs as a repeater. Priors as related by this count are acknowledged. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts plea and finds the defnedant guilty. 

Court orders: 18 months probation sentence withheld with conditions. 
Conditions of Probation:
60 days jail with Huber all stayed pending further order of the court.
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. 
court costs and surcharges

Anything else is ordered dismissed and read in. Jail credit if revoked: 2 days

9:31 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jared A. Erickson in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Jared A. Erickson. 
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 
File is referred to Branch 4 to schedule ARGN.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing.
Defendant updates address with the Court.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on July 18, 2022 at 1:45 pm.
Hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
No contact with G.K.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
